availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Daniel H. Howard (Lebanon, Marion County, Kentucky, clerk and merchant)

body.p: Lebanon, Marion County, Kentucky, clerk and merchant. Maine native. Son of Stillman L. Howard and Julia A. Howard. Clerk in Marion County in 1860. Merchant in Marion County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, County, City/District, p. X
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Maine, Kennebec County, Leeds, p. 40.
Find A Grave, "Daniel H. Howard (1840-1913)," Memorial #112710674, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/112710674 (accessed February 5, 2019).
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Marion County, KY, May 1865, p. 229, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
